definition: curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)

sentences.english: Make curtains of goat hair for the tent over the tabernacle-eleven altogether.
sentences.chinese: 你要用山羊毛織十一幅幔子，作爲帳幕以上的罩棚。

sentences.english: The families of the sons of Kohath shall pitch on the side of the tabernacle southward.
sentences.chinese: 哥轄兒子的諸族要在帳幕的南邊安營。

sentences.english: And he made boards for the tabernacle of shittim wood， standing up.
sentences.chinese: 他用皂莢木作帳幕的豎板。

sentences.english: And Moses took the anointing oil, and anointed the tabernacle and all that was therein, and sanctified them.
sentences.chinese: 摩西用膏油抹帳幕和其中所有的，使它成聖。

sentences.english: And he shall plant the tabernacles of his palace between the seas in the glorious holy mountain;
sentences.chinese: 他必在海和榮美的聖山中間設立他如宮殿的帳幕。

sentences.english: Khan and the Mongolian Kings times khanates of tent accommodation 2000.
sentences.chinese: 蒙古汗國時代可汗及諸王的帳幕可容2000人。

sentences.english: The boy scouts pitched a tent in a field.
sentences.chinese: 童子軍們在田野裏張起帳幕。

sentences.english: Then Moses set up the courtyard around the tabernacle and altar and put up the curtain at the entrance to the courtyard.
sentences.chinese: 在帳幕和壇的四圍，立了院帷，把院子的門簾掛上。

sentences.english: So all the work on the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting, was completed.
sentences.chinese: 帳幕，就是會幕，一切的工就這樣做完了。

sentences.english: They made curtains of goat hair for the tent over the tabernacle-eleven altogether.
sentences.chinese: 他用山羊毛織十一幅幔子，作爲帳幕以上的罩棚。

sentences.english: That is how it continued to be; the cloud covered it, and at night it looked like fire.
sentences.chinese: 白天有云彩遮蓋帳幕，夜間雲彩形狀像火。

sentences.english: Rui jia found someone come near the tent, it was discovered looked up job.
sentences.chinese: 瑞嘉發現有人走近帳幕，擡頭一看發現原來是瑞薏。

sentences.english: They made upright frames of acacia wood for the tabernacle.
sentences.chinese: 他用皂莢木做帳幕的豎板。

sentences.english: Place the gold altar of incense in front of the ark of the Testimony and put the curtain at the entrance to the tabernacle.
sentences.chinese: 把燒香的金壇安在法櫃前，掛上帳幕的門簾。

sentences.english: So that he forsook the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent which he placed among men;
sentences.chinese: 甚至他離棄示羅的帳幕，就是他在人間所搭的帳棚。

sentences.english: And thou shalt make curtains of goats' hair to be a covering upon the tabernacle: eleven curtains shalt thou make.
sentences.chinese: 你要用山羊毛織十一幅幔子，作爲帳幕以上的罩棚。

definition: tabernacle (biblical word for a meeting hall or tent)
variant of 帳篷|帐篷[zhang4 peng5]
door/the opening panel of a door
